newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius issues $75 million of long term bonds.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius issues $75 million of long term bonds.

text.p: The central Bank of Mauritius on Wednesday issued 1.5 billion rupees ($75 million) of bonds with maturities of 10, 15 and 20 years, officials said.
They bank said it received bids worth 3 billion rupees during a Tuesday auction that put on tender sale 1.5 billion rupees worth of long term bonds.

The bank said it accepted bids worth 833 million rupees for the 10 year, 636 million rupees for the 15 year and 31 million rupees for the 20 year bonds, with weighted yields of 10.67 percent, 11.06 percent and 10.90 percent respectively.
The bonds carry coupons of 9.50 percent, 10.00 percent and 10.25 percent respectively. Payments are twice yearly on January 15 and July 15.
